intro: Sida obovata, commonly known as the broad-leaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is an annual herb that typically grows in moist habitats such as wetlands and marshes. The plant has alternate, ovate to obovate leaves with a rough texture. Its small, white or pale blue flowers are clustered in spikes, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Sida obovata is often found in wetland ecosystems and is adapted to thrive in saturated soil conditions.
